description: From Middle English onfal, onfalle, equivalent to on- +‎ fall. Cognate with Dutch aanval (“an attack, assault”), German Anfall (“an attack, seizure, fit”), Swedish anfall (“an attack, offensive, assault”). Compare also Middle English onfallynge (“an onslaught, attack”).

entries.meaning: A falling on or upon; an attack, onset, or assault.
examples: The onfall of the bishops had helped to wreck this possibility, [...]

entries.meaning: A fall of rain or snow.

verbs.description: onfall (third-person singular simple present onfalls, present participle onfalling, simple past onfell, past participle onfallen)

examples: [...] have been formed and ripened in large numbers, especially on the shaded ower sides of the leaves, the mycelium is practically exhausted, and as these processes are completed towards the end of the summer, the leaf so onfalls.
